page.title: 08C.E. School,Little Horsted.
page.content: This{'family'}School,built in about 1862,is surrounded by countryside. It is a{Church School}and has End of Term Services at St.Michael's Church. There have been{major changes}in the past 20 years. A wooden building was erected in two phases as the original was not adequate. The first part was finished in 1968,the second in 1971. When{Isfield School}closed in 1970 because of falling numbers,16 pupils were transferred to Horsted bringing the number on roll on 3.9.70. to 67. The most pupils there have been was 99. The limit is now 80. Its{catchment {area}is quite large. More children are now coming from{Ridgewood}than from the{Isfield}area. Most pupils from Isfield come by coach but some travel in cars as do the Ridgewood children. Few walk as the roads are busy & it is more convenient to come by car or bus.
